title: Strike Blocks LNG Cargo Arrivals at French Import Terminals
summary: French LNG terminals operator Elengy has issued force majeure notices to customers that its three import facilities in France will not be receiving cargoes until October 2 due to a prolonged strike, a company spokesperson told Reuters on Friday. France is gripped by a nationwide strike over pay and…

title: Vitol Nears Deal to Sell Iraqi Kurdistan Oil Exports
summary: The world’s largest independent oil trader, Vitol Group, is in discussions with Iraq to sell crude from Kurdistan when the pipeline flows from the semi-autonomous northern Iraqi region to Turkey resume, sources with knowledge of the talks told Bloomberg on Friday. title: Arbitrage Window Closing for American Crude in Asia
summary: The arbitrage window for American crude shipments to Asia could soon close amid surging tanker rates and cheaper Middle Eastern oil which is also closer to the world’s top demand region than the U.S. Gulf Coast. The rates for chartering a supertanker, the so-called very large crude carrier (VLCC) c…

title: OPEC+ Oil Production Hike May Not Be as Steep as Feared
summary: The OPEC+ group is not hiking oil production as much as the headline figures in the agreement suggest, as some members are close to capacity while others are compensating for previous overproduction. title: Giant Oil Trader Begins Physical Trading In Uranium
summary: Giant oil and gas trader Mercuria reportedly has begun physical trading in uranium, becoming the first major commodity company to do so, according to Reuters. summary: The executives' anonymous comments were published in a quarterly survey of oil and gas companies by the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas this week.
